level.text: Any hearing required by D.C. Law 6-100, the “Litter Control Administration Act of 1985″ (D.C. Code ยง6-2901 et seq.) or this chapter shall be held before a Hearing Examiner or the Chief, Office of Public Space Adjudication. No other person shall have the authority to adjudicate the solid waste or public space violations specified by the “Litter Control Administration Act of 1985″ or to dismiss a Notice that has been returned to the Department.
A Hearing Examiner shall have the following powers, in addition to any other powers specified in this chapter:
To examine witnesses and to take testimony;
To request the Superior Court of the District of Columbia to issue subpoena;
To rule upon offers of proof and to receive relevant evidence;
To regulate the course and conduct of hearings;
To hold conferences before, during, or after a hearing to settle or simplify issues;
To make final determinations as provided herein or by law;
To take any other action authorized by this chapter, the Administrative Procedure Act, or by any other applicable statute, rule or regulation;
Upon application, to reopen the record to receive additional evidence; and
To review charges for abatement activities performed by the Mayor.
1310 3 A Hearing Examiner shall not hear any case in which he or she has any interest with either a party or the matter pending.
